intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. cymantha, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy stems and leaves. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces numerous small, white to yellow flowers in the summer months. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
